00045 string EGS_cSpheres::type = "EGS_cSpheres";
00046 
00047 // generate the concentric spheres
00048 EGS_cSpheres::EGS_cSpheres(int ns, const EGS_Float *radius,
00049         const EGS_Vector &position, const string &Name) :
00050         EGS_BaseGeometry(Name), xo(position) {
00051 
00052     if(ns>0) {
00053 
00054         R2=new EGS_Float [ns]; R=new EGS_Float [ns];
00055 
00056         // ... and sphere radii
00057         for(int i=0;i<ns;i++) {
00058             R2[i]=radius[i]*radius[i]; R[i]=radius[i];
00059         }
00060 
00061         // for n-concentric spheres, we have n separate regions
00062         nreg=ns;
00063     }
00064 }
00065 
00066 bool EGS_cSpheres::isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00067     EGS_Vector tmp(x-xo); EGS_Float r_sq=tmp.length2();
00068     if(r_sq>R2[nreg-1]) return false;
00069     return true;
00070 }
00071 
00072 int EGS_cSpheres::isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00073     EGS_Vector tmp(x-xo); EGS_Float r_sq=tmp.length2();
00074     if(r_sq>R2[nreg-1]) return -1;
00075     if(r_sq<R2[0]) return 0;
00076     return findRegion(r_sq,nreg-1,R2)+1;
00077 }
00078 
00079 // method to determine which spheres we are in(between)
00080 int EGS_cSpheres::inside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00081 
00082     EGS_Vector tmp(x-xo);
00083     EGS_Float r_sq=tmp.length2();
00084 
00085   // are we outside off all spheres? If so return that region number
00086   if(r_sq>R2[nreg-1]) return -1;
00087 
00088 /*
00089  * algorithm below fails for particle in central sphere ...ugh!
00090  */if(r_sq<R2[0]) return 0;
00091 
00092   // search for region containing particle
00093   int is=0,os=nreg,ms;
00094   while(os-is>1) {
00095       ms=(is+os)/2;
00096       if(r_sq<=R2[ms]) os=ms; else is=ms;
00097   }
00098   return os;
00099 }
00100 
00101 // howfar is particle trajectory from sphere boundary
00102 /* note that in general we will be between two spheres (if inside a sphere at
00103  * all... so we need to check if the flight path will intersect the inner or
00104  * outer sphere
00105  */
00106 
00107 #ifdef SPHERES_DEBUG
00108 EGS_Vector last_x, last_u;
00109 int last_ireg;
00110 EGS_Float last_d,last_t,last_aa,last_bb2,last_R2b2,last_tmp;
00111 #endif
00112 
00113 EGS_Float EGS_cSpheres::howfarToOutside(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x,
00114                 const EGS_Vector &u) {
00115     if( ireg < 0 ) return 0;
00116     EGS_Vector xp(x - xo);
00117     EGS_Float aa = xp*u, aa2 = aa*aa;
00118     EGS_Float bb2 = xp.length2();
00119     EGS_Float R2b2 = R2[nreg-1] - bb2;
00120     if( R2b2 <= 0 ) return 0; // outside within precision
00121     EGS_Float tmp = sqrt(aa2 + R2b2);
00122     return aa > 0 ? R2b2/(tmp + aa) : tmp - aa;
00123 }
00124 
00125 int EGS_cSpheres::howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x,
00126             const EGS_Vector &u, EGS_Float &t, int *newmed, EGS_Vector *normal)
00127 {
00128   int direction_flag=-1;  /* keep track of direction entering or exiting a
00129                              sphere boundary */
00130   double d=1e35;      // set a maximum distance from a boundary
00131 
00132   EGS_Vector xp(x - xo);
00133   double aa = xp*u, aa2 = aa*aa;
00134   double bb2 = xp.length2();
00135 
00136   double rad, R2b2, tmp;
00137 
00138   // check if we are inside of any regions at all? ...
00139   if(ireg>=0) {
00140 
00141       /* check if particle is moving towards or away from the sphere(s) centre.
00142        * we loose here if the particle is in the centre sphere as we don't need
00143        * to check this condition. see next 'if' statement
00144        */
00145       if( aa >= 0 || !ireg ) {
00146 
00147           /* ie. particle moving away from center of
00148              spheres, OR it is IN the innermost sphere
00149              => we must check the outer sphere only
00150            */
00151           R2b2 = R2[ireg] - bb2;
00152           if( R2b2 <= 0 && aa > 0 ) d = 1e-15; // hopefully a truncation problem
00153           else {
00154               tmp = aa2 + R2b2;
00155               if( tmp > 0 ) tmp = sqrt(tmp);
00156               else {
00157                   if( tmp < -1e-2 ) {
00158                       egsWarning("EGS_cSpheres::howfar: something is wrong\n");
00159                       egsWarning("  we think we are in region %d, but R2b2=%g",
00160                               ireg,R2b2);
00161                   }
00162                   tmp = 0;
00163               }
00164               d = aa > 0 ? R2b2/(tmp + aa) : tmp - aa;
00165               // the above reduces roundoff, which is significant
00166               // when aa2 is large compared to R2b2 and aa>0
00167           }
00168           rad = -R[ireg];
00169           direction_flag=ireg+1;
00170           if( direction_flag >= nreg ) direction_flag = -1;
00171       }
00172       else {
00173 
00174           /* so now we know the particle is moving towards the centre of the
00175            * spheres.  check to see if its trajectory will intersect the nested
00176            * sphere - we are guaranteed there is one - we checked that already!
00177            */
00178           R2b2 = R2[ireg-1] - bb2;
00179           tmp = aa2 + R2b2;
00180           if( tmp <= 0 ) {  // we will not intersect the nested sphere
00181               R2b2 = R2[ireg] - bb2;
00182               tmp = aa2 + R2b2;
00183               if( tmp > 0 ) d = sqrt(tmp) - aa;
00184               else d = -aa;
00185               rad = -R[ireg];
00186               direction_flag=ireg+1;
00187               if( direction_flag >= nreg ) direction_flag = -1;
00188           }
00189           else {
00190               // we're hitting the inner sphere (from the outside)
00191               tmp = sqrt(tmp);
00192               d = -R2b2/(tmp - aa);
00193               direction_flag=ireg-1;
00194               rad = R[direction_flag];
00195           }
00196       }
00197   }
00198   else {
00199       // we are not inside any of the spherical regions of interest
00200       if(aa<0) { // we _might_ intersect the largest sphere
00201           R2b2 = R2[nreg-1] - bb2;
00202           tmp = aa2 + R2b2;
00203           if( tmp > 0 ) { // we *will* intersect the largest sphere
00204               d = -R2b2/(sqrt(tmp) - aa);
00205               direction_flag=nreg-1;
00206               rad = R[direction_flag];
00207           }
00208       }
00209   }
00210 
00211 #ifdef SPHERES_DEBUG
00212   if( isnan(d) ) {
00213       egsWarning("\nGot nan\n");
00214   }
00215 
00216   if( d < -1e-4 ) {
00217       egsWarning("\nNegative step?: %g\n",d);
00218       egsWarning("ireg=%d inew=%d aa=%g bb2=%g\n",ireg,direction_flag,aa,bb2);
00219       //exit(1);
00220   }
00221 
00222   last_x = x; last_u = u; last_ireg = ireg; last_d = d; last_t = t;
00223   last_aa = aa; last_bb2 = bb2; last_R2b2 = R2b2; last_tmp = tmp;
00224 #endif
00225 
00226   // check desired step size against this d
00227   if(d<=t) {
00228       t=d;
00229       if( newmed ) if( direction_flag >= 0 ) *newmed = medium(direction_flag);
00230                    else *newmed = -1;
00231       if( normal ) {
00232           EGS_Vector n(xp + u*d); *normal = n*(1/rad);
00233       }
00234       return direction_flag;
00235   }
00236   return ireg;
00237 }
00238 
00239 // hownear - closest perpendicular distance to sphere surface
00240 EGS_Float EGS_cSpheres::hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x)
00241 {
00242   EGS_Vector xp(x-xo);
00243   EGS_Float r=xp.length();
00244   //EGS_Float r_sq=x.x*x.x+x.y*x.y+x.z*x.z;
00245   EGS_Float d;
00246 
00247   if(ireg>=0) {
00248       d=R[ireg]-r;
00249       if(ireg) { EGS_Float dd=r-R[ireg-1]; if(dd<d) d=dd; }
00250   }
00251   else d=r-R[nreg-1];
00252 
00253   return d;
00254 }
00255 
00256 void EGS_cSpheres::printInfo() const {
00257     EGS_BaseGeometry::printInfo();
00258     egsInformation(" midpoint of spheres = (%g,%g,%g)\n",xo.x,xo.y,xo.z);
00259     egsInformation(" sphere radii = ");
00260     for(int j=0; j<nreg; j++) egsInformation("%g ",R[j]);
00261     egsInformation(
00262             "\n=======================================================\n");
00263 }

00265 extern "C" {
00266 
00267 EGS_SPHERES_EXPORT EGS_BaseGeometry* createGeometry(EGS_Input *input) {
00268     if( !input ) {
00269         egsWarning("createGeometry(spheres): null input?\n");
00270         return 0;
00271     }
00272     EGS_Vector xo; vector<EGS_Float> Xo;
00273     int err = input->getInput("midpoint",Xo);
00274     if( !err && Xo.size() == 3 ) xo = EGS_Vector(Xo[0],Xo[1],Xo[2]);
00275     vector<EGS_Float> radii;
00276     err = input->getInput("radii",radii);
00277     if( err ) {
00278         egsWarning("createGeometry(spheres): wrong/missing 'radii' input\n");
00279         return 0;
00280     }
00281     EGS_Float *r = new EGS_Float [radii.size()];
00282     for(int j=0; j<radii.size(); j++) r[j] = radii[j];
00283     EGS_BaseGeometry *result = new EGS_cSpheres(radii.size(),r,xo);
00284     result->setName(input);
00285     result->setMedia(input);
00286     result->setLabels(input);
00287     return result;
00288 }
